column1: Tolkien explained the origin of the word [[Mirkwood]], and that he did not invent it himself, but took it from an [[wikipedia:Myrkviðr
column2: Myrkviðr]], a large forest that was traditionally held as the border between the Goths and the Huns.

column1: Only the beginning and ending of this letter was published in ''The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien''. The middle paragraph, along with the other two paragraphs, appeared in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'' (see [[Letter to Michael George Tolkien (29 July 1966)]]).
